main event: An unidentified flying object was observed by ten crew members of the 52nd Bombardment Squadron at Lake Charles AFB, Louisiana on February 12, 1953.
interesting points: The object was delta shaped and approximately 15 feet in diameter., The observation lasted for about 12 seconds and occurred at 1950 hours., The object appeared to be traveling at an estimated speed of 1,500 miles per hour., Weather conditions at the time were described as clear with visibility around 10 miles., Observers were considered reliable and there was no other traffic in the area during the sighting.
witness description: crew members of the 52nd Bombardment Squadron
